entry.title: Litecoin Whale Withdraws $20 Million In LTC From Binance: Bullish Sign?
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows a Litecoin whale has withdrawn around $20 million in LTC from Binance, which could be bullish for the asset‚Äôs price.
Litecoin Whale Has Just Made A Large Outflow From Binance
According to data from the cryptocurrency transaction tracker service Whale Alert, a massive transfer has been spotted on the Litecoin blockchain during the past day.
The transaction saw the movement of 286,482 LTC across the network, worth almost $20.6 million when the move went through. Given this large scale, it‚Äôs likely that a whale entity was behind it.
Whales are considered influential beings on the blockchain due to their large holdings, so their transactions can be worth keeping an eye on as they may end up causing fluctuations in the asset‚Äôs price.

entry.title: Abra Settles with 25 US State Regulators, Agrees to Return $82M to Customers
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrency company Abra and its CEO, William ‚ÄúBill‚Äù Barhydt, settled with 25 state financial regulators in the United States for operating a crypto business without obtaining appropriate licenses. Apparently, it offered crypto trading and investing services without any license. Announced yesterday (Wednesday) by the Conference of State Bank Supervisors (CSBS), the participating states in the settlement are Alaska, Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Connecticut, District of Columbia, Georgia, Idaho, Iowa, Maine, Minnesota, Mississippi, Nevada, New Mexico, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oregon, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas, Vermont, Washington, and West Virginia. Returning Customer Funds

entry.title: Busted: Florida Resident Found Guilty in Series of Crypto-Related Home Invasions
entry.summary:
In a notable legal development involving crypto, Remy St. Felix, a 24-year-old from West Palm Beach, Florida, was recently convicted by a federal jury in Greensboro, North Carolina, for orchestrating a series of violent home invasions targeting crypto owners in states, including North Carolina, Florida, Texas, and New York.
This case sheds light on a growing criminal trend where digital asset holders are directly attacked in their homes, reflecting the increasing intersection of traditional crime with the crypto market.
Detailed Investigation Leads to Conviction
St. Felix, who faced multiple charges, including conspiracy, kidnapping, and Hobbs Act robbery, was found guilty of utilizing extreme measures to extract crypto assets from his victims forcibly.
The trial brought to the f‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
Hong Kong is positioning itself as a leader in the global fintech landscape by focusing on crypto-related sectors such as decentralized finance (DeFi) and the Metaverse.
Recent government-backed studies conducted by the Hong Kong Institute for Monetary and Financial Research (HKIMR), part of the Hong Kong Academy of Finance (AoF), have underscored the importance of these digital frontiers in shaping the future of finance in Hong Kong.
The reports released on June 25 analyze the impact and potential of DeFi and Metaverse technologies, highlighting their rapid growth and emerging opportunities.

Bitcoin Needs To Grow Its Adoption This Much To Challenge The USD

‚ÄúThe financial world now believes Bitcoin is a fast emerging asset class,‚Äù says Woo. At present, though, the coin only has a total market cap of around $1.2 trillion, while the analyst notes that asset classes are generally valued in ‚Äúunits of tens of trillion.‚Äù

entry.title: Bitcoin And Ethereum Traders Cool Down on Bearish Bets, Put-Call Ratio Retreating In June
entry.summary:
Bitcoin, Ethereum, and top altcoins are falling at spot rates. As of writing, Bitcoin is teetering around the $60,000 level and still unable to reverse the sharp losses of June 24, when prices cratered, dipping to the $50,000 territory.
Bitcoin And Ethereum Put-Call Ratio Falling
Even so, there appear to be changes. According to Kaiko, a crypto analytics platform, traders are upbeat about what lies ahead. The put-to-call ratio for both Bitcoin and Ethereum declined in June after the brief increase in May.
Technically, the put-call ratio is a crucial metric used to gauge market sentiment. To calculate it, analysts divide the total trading volume of put options by that of call options.
In options trading, ‚Äúputs‚Äù denote contracts of traders banking on prices to drop. At the same t‚Ä¶

LayerZero airdrop coming June 20th. SEC concerns on USDC may delay Circle IPO. Hayes increasing PENDLE & DOGE positions. Fox News to build L2 with Polygon. EIGEN trades at $10bn pre-market. Drift & Ondo partner on RWAs. Commercial real estate coming on-chain: KPMG.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 140 - MARKETS DOWN BAD
entry.summary: BTC touches 1-month lows, dominance hits 56%. $500m of liquidations in fall, $146m ETF outflows. VanEck to launch first ETF in Australia. Coinbase to launch pre-market trading. 56% of Fortune 500 building in web3. Uphold to delist USDT in EU due to MiCA. TON flips DOGE in sell-off. Base DEX users now 2nd place after SOL. Ethena launches staking & restaking with Symbiotic. Lens aiming to raise $50m at $500m valuation. Two ‚Äòcrazy‚Äô MATIC announcements coming.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 139 - WHATS THE NEXT META?
entry.summary: BTC again breaks $66k, dominance rises. Fear & Greed index hits 3 month low. Whales continue to be in accumulation mode. Miners 33 days into capitulation, average 41 days. Financial advisors not buying BTC yet: BlackRock. Crypto funds saw $600m outflows last week. ZKsync airdrop live, prices at $5bn FDV. ZKsync defend sybil measures. Low float, high FDV coins get hammered again. Tether launches product backed by Gold. Korean exchanges reviewing 600 coins for delisting. ETH ETF ‚Äòsell the rumour, buy the news event‚Äô. BTC ETF basis buyers roughly 15% of demand. CVX bounces 100% after loan liquidation. TON sees fastest user growth in crypto history. APT may flip SOL in 1-3 years: Hayes. Crypto lifetime funding eclipses $100bn. SEC claims $876m Ripple fine still fair. Gensler could cost Biden election: Cuban.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 138 - MORE CELEB COINS!
entry.summary: Altcoins bleed out heavy, BTC dominance rises towards 60%. Miners continue to be large BTC sellers, whales accumulate. ETF inflows slow, hedge fund allocations point to basis trades. ETH ETFs approvals see little movement, coming 'in the summer‚Äô. Stocks continue to hit ATHs as CPI & PPI both come in soft. TON performs best in L1s, active wallets eclipse ETH. Andrew Tate joins celebrity memecoin meta, DADDY hits $350m. SOL DEX volumes eclipse ETH in memecoin frenzy. Curve founder defaults on CRV debt as DeFi coins tumble. Terraform Labs & Do Kwon to pay $4.5bn fine to SEC. BAMK hits $350m in Runes as it issues BTC stablecoin. Gaming tokens face huge sell-off, PRIME changes tokenomics.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 137 - CRYPTO DIPS FURTHER
entry.summary: Crypto falls after slightly hawkish Fed speech. BTC whales buy $1.4bn in 24hrs. Miners continue to be large sellers of BTC. BTC ETFs see $100m inflows. MicroStrategy to raise $500m to buy BTC. Egorov CRV debt positions begin to liquidate . Circle to support SOL for wallets. 4% of Turkey GDP used to buy stablecoins. QuantMatter say $11m stolen from OKX account. Biden to use Coinbase for crypto donations. Terraform Labs & Do Kwon set to pay $4.5bn fine. Franklin Templeton write report on SOL DePin. TON flips ETH for active addresses. Moonpay & Paypal integration goes live in EU & UK.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 136 - FIRST MOTHER, NOW DADDY?
entry.summary: BTC ETFs see another $200m outflows. Another $190m of liquidations in volatility. $1.2bn BTC leaves exchanges in a day. ETF flows largely driven by basis trades: Pal. ‚ÄòPerfect setup‚Äô for longs into macro news today. ETH ETF approvals ‚Äòexpected this month‚Äô. Crypto in best place it has ever been: Circle CEO. China‚Äôs ICBC calls ETH ‚Äòdigital oil‚Äô. Trump wants ‚Äòmade in the USA‚Äô BTC. Crypto hacks $19bn since 2011. Symbiotic restaking protocol sees $150m inflows. Polygon launches $720m grants program. ZKsync accused of insider allocations. CRV drop leaves $90m loans at risk.

entry.title: Has AI Already Changed Gaming Forever?
entry.summary: Decrypt‚Äôs Sander Lutz and Rug Radio creator Puke sat down with Simon Davis of Mighty Bear Games and VC Kyle Klemmer to discuss how AI has already remade the gaming industry‚Äîfor better and for worse.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 135 - BTC FALLS ON OUTFLOWS
entry.summary: Crypto falls as ETFs see first outflow in 19 days. Short positions grow on downwards move in BTC. BTC short-term realised price now at $64k. ETH ETF issuers still waiting for SEC response. UK ETNs continue to see tiny volume. SOL validators get kicked out for sandwich attacks. ZKsync airdrop happening next week. ZKsync to give 17.8% to the community. OP launches Fraud Proofs. Bitfarms plans poison pill to counter takeover bid. OKX sees outflows after security incidents. Bybit considers shutting China offices. COIN may get added to S&P500.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 134 - EU SNAP ELECTIONS LAND
entry.summary: Volatility remains low, TL continues to be divisive. 2nd highest weekly close ever for BTC. Crypto funds saw $2bn inflows last week. Rumour that BlackRock will apply for SOL ETF. Base TVL hits $8bn, top of L2s for activity. zk Sync hint at TGE this week. PENDLE enters top 5 for DeFi TVL. Berachain v2 testnet goes live.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 133 - RUGGED BY HOGEN?
entry.summary: BTC still just below ATH after $218m ETF inflows. BTC OI hits record $37bn as long-short ratio rises. Amount of ETH on exchanges lowest since 2015. Franklin Templeton explores broader crypto fund. Mining stocks rise on takeover frenzy. Kraken considers $100m funding round. Binance reinstates crypto buys with Mastercard. Phantom & Jito partner for native staking.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 132 - CRYPTO STRENGTH IS GROWING
entry.summary: Crypto consolidates near ATH, $488m ETF inflow. BTC correlation to tech stocks highest since 2023. BTC options anticipate $74-80k move. ETH to $22k by 2030: VanEck. Robinhood to acquire Bitstamp. Coinbase launches Smart Wallet. ByBit opens up explicitly to China users. Global liquidity breaks out to $94T. US President given new powers to block crypto. Cramer & Gensler continue to bash crypto. Gensler hints at prolonged ETH ETF process. Stand with Crypto PAC hits 1m advocates. Turkey denies plans to tax crypto. EigenLayer surpasses $20bn TVL. IONET to launch on Binance.

entry.title: Webinar: Unleashing The Power Of Permissionless Markets With Vega Protocol
entry.summary: Join our expert panel for an insightful discussion on Vega Protocol's revolutionary approach to decentralized derivatives trading. Discover how Vega's permissionless markets enable anyone to create and trade futures and perpetuals on a fully decentralized network. Explore the potential of Vega's innovative features, such as the ability to add new assets, transfer network assets, and adjust network parameters‚Äîas well as the protocol's active markets.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 131 - BIG BITCOIN INFLOWS!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs see large $900M inflows, biggest in weeks. $800M of shorts would be liquidated above $72K. BTC to $100K if it breaks $73K in a week: Novogratz. BNB hits new ATH, breaks $100B market cap. FTX reaches $200M tax settlement with IRS. Most investors should hold BTC: Fidelity. Tether CEO criticises EU on stablecoin regulation. Japanese exchange raises $320M to recover funds. ETH ETFs could see $4B inflows in 5 months: K33. Paradigm propose MEV taxes. StarkWare plans ZK scaling for BTC.
